body.p: Your petitioners, the undersigned, would respectfully represent & state that One, Jesse T. McCormack, was recognized to appear at the July term 1862 of the Warren Equity & criminal court, in a bond of four hundred dollars, with the Subscribers his security. The said Jesse T. is & was a young & inexperienced man & by the adice of evil disposed persons & contrary to the advice & wishes of your petitioners, he left this state & of consequince, his bond was, at the Feby. term 1863, forfeited ^and judgement rendered thereon at sd last mentioned term^ & your peititioners, and now liable to pay the judgement of 400$ so as aforesaid rendered against them. By the courtesy of the Comths" atty. the execution is suspended until so can hear from your excellency. Now we beg leave to state that all of by, with One exception, and in very limited cirumstances & have as much as we can conveniently do to support our families & to pay the afd. judgement, altho" apparently small, will oppress us. Wherefore we respectfully ^pray^ a remission of the afd. Judgt. or so much thereof as you are authorized to remit.

As execution has been suspended
until we can hear from you. Permit us to hope to receive a favorable response at your earliest convenience.

With high consideration, we are
Very respectfully
Your Obt Scts

Wm Halsell
James M. Halsell
John S. Jones
John W. Grubbs
James Jones
James J. McCormick

Respite for 12 mos
Thos E Bramlette
Oct 24th 1863

We the undersigned citizens of Warren County state that we know the gentlemen whose signatures appear above, & have implicit confidence in the truth of their above statements, and concur with them in their ^prayer &^ foregoing petition

W H Payne
Wm Loving
R Rodes
P. Hines
